intro: Trigonella gordejevii, commonly known as the Armenian bitter vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its legume pods and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated pods and are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Trigonella gordejevii is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh conditions.
